titleStmt.title: The antivenereal apozem. A pleasant liquor, which in thirty days (without any other assistance) perfectly cures the most inveterate pox in any age, sex or constitution, by an easie familiar operation that puts the patient to no manner of trouble or inconveniency, but an exact regulation of diet.
titleStmt.author: Noy, Arthur.

notesStmt.note: Title taken from caption and first lines of text.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
